Others: The Dallas Mavericks broke their five-game losing streak with a win over the Los Angeles Lakers, 118-97.
Spencer Dinwiddie's goal was to hold the Lakers below 100 points, which they achieved.
The Mavericks had a significant advantage from the three-point line, hitting seven more threes than the Lakers.
Despite a near triple-double from LeBron James, the Mavericks mostly held Anthony Davis in check.
Quentin Grimes delivered one of his best performances with 23 points, nine rebounds, and six assists on 6/11 shooting from three-point range.
The Mavericks kept the turnovers down, committing just ten compared to their recent games.
The Mavericks had a much better defensive performance, holding the Lakers to 45.3% from the floor and 31.4% from three.
